attributes.action: pay for a statue in manchester in memory of the peterloo massacre
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: in 1819 a terrible act took place. that day was supposed to be a happy family day out and to listen to the speeches and have a fun day. then the calvary was ordered to arrest but killed, trampled and hurt inocent families. im petioning for a statue to be put by the tiny plaque im memory of everyone who died that day and those who were seriously injured.

rejection.details: Statues and memorials are not normally sponsored by central Government but usually result from private initiatives. The promoters of a statue or memorial can achieve their aims by setting up a Charitable Trust, identifying a site and commissioning a designer, raising the necessary finance and obtaining the appropriate consents from the relevant planning authorities.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
